alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Howell; Ozark; Shannon; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 03 at 4:16AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Howell, Shannon and Texas. In southwest Missouri, Douglas and Ozark. * WHEN...Until 100 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 416 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Lick Creek at County Road 528, North Fork River at County Road 278, Big Creek at County Road 390, South Fork Jacks Fork River at Stillhouse Road and Spring Creek at County Road 349. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Plains, Willow Springs, Cabool, Gainesville, Summersville, Raymondville, Bakersfield and Pomona. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
